page.title: 01Stoke Ash & Thornham Magna
page.content: This area includes the village of Thornham Magna & part of Stoke Ash. These are rural villages and permitted development is restricted. Main Ipswich/Norwich road passes through the eastern three blocks, and main railway line throughblocks one & five. The area is largely cultivated farmland, main crops being wheat, oil seed rape, barley, winter beans and sugar beet. About 50% of the population work locally, farmers and tradesmen others commute to larger centres. The central part of the area is part of the Thornham estate which has belonged to the Henniker family since 1765. The estate follows a policy of developing crafts and recreational facilities. There are currently seven workshops as well as a sawmill and a field centre. There is also a camp and a caravan
